alert.note: Alert for Northern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 14 at 3:23AM MST until December 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...POTENT WINTER STORM CONTINUES TODAY... .A strong winter storm will continue to impact the region through Wednesday night and early Thursday, with heavy snow, wind, and blizzard conditions for the northeast Wyoming and western South Dakota plains. Additional snow amounts will generally be highest across far northeast Wyoming, the northern Black Hills area, and south central South Dakota. In addition, strong northwest winds gusting 35 to 50 mph at times on the plains will continue to support blizzard or near blizzard conditions at times. Listen to NOAA Weather Radio or your local media for the latest updates on this storm. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches across the favored areas from Lead and Deadwood to west of Cheyenne Crossing, with 3 to 10 inches expected elsewhere. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...The Northern Black Hills. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
